meanings.definition: A young sheep of either sex that is between one and two years old.
meanings.sent1: The farmer raised a hogget on his farm.
meanings.sent2: The hogget grazed peacefully in the meadow.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous hogget managed to escape the pen again.
meanings.sent4: The hogget's fleece was as soft as a cloud.
meanings.sent5: Children loved to play with the friendly hogget in the field.

meanings.sent1: The chef prepared a delicious stew using hogget meat.
meanings.sent2: The hogget meat was tender and flavorful.
meanings.sent3: The family enjoyed a hearty meal of roasted hogget.
meanings.sent4: The aroma of the cooking hogget filled the kitchen.
meanings.sent5: The butcher displayed fresh hogget cuts in the market.
